results.title: Tintin et les Oranges Bleues
results.brief_description:
Professor Zalamea, a Spanish scientist, sends to Prof. Tournesol a blue orange with mysterious properties. But the orange is stolen soon after. Tintin, Captain Haddock and Snowy set off in hot pursuit

Credits: Director, Philippe Condroyer ; writer, Andre Barret ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Talbot, Jean Bouise, Jenny Orleans, Felix Fernandez, Max Elloy.

results.title: Tinker tailor soldier spy
results.creator_credit: BBC Enterprises, Jonathan Powell and John irvin
results.brief_description: Dramatised for television by Arthur Hopcraft, this acclaimed adaptation of John Le Carre’s gripping novel of international espionage and betrayal stars Sir Alec Guinness in a superb portrayal of George Smiley, retired spymaster of the Circus - Britain’s spy control. He left the Circus in a storm of controversy with some saying he was sacked after the Czech scandal and others saying he is in innocent retirement. However, all agree nobody leaves the Circus without some unfinished business. Brought in to trace an infiltrator in the Department where he was once the prize employee, the self-effacing master of espionage resolutely moves in to spy on the spies and finds himself going over very old ground. This film is part of the Le Carre Trilogy. The other parts are “Smiley’s people” and “A Perfect spy”.

results.title: Tina: what's love got to do with it
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Doug Chapin, Barry Krost and Brian Gibson
results.brief_description: Biographical film based on the book ‘I, Tina’ by Tina Turner and Kurt Loder about the dynamic American R&B/Pop singer, Tina Turner and her violent relationship with her singer/songwriter husband, Ike Turner. The story begins with Tina’s early days in Nutbush, and follows through to her move to St Louis where she meets up with local nightclub singer, Ike Turner. Ike asks Tina to join him on stage and as they say, the rest is musical history. Their professional relationship developed into a romantic relationship and eventually marriage. What followed however, is quite disturbing and is realistically presented in this powerful and inspirational story with stunning performances by Angela Bassett as Tina and Laurence Fishburne as Ike. Also stars Jenifer Lewis, Phyllis Stickney and Tina Turner.

results.title: Tin miners of Malaysia
results.brief_description:
Examines Kinta Valley area in the Malaysian mountains which contains the world’s largest tin deposit. Follows a 16 year old boy and his family to show lifestyles of Malaysian miners and to increase the understanding of a country whose people are of many races and national origins.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Tin men
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Mark Johnson and Barry Levinson
results.brief_description: A tale of two hustlers in competition with each other, one a smooth-talking ladies’ man, the other a loser surrounded by debt and emotional problems. Set in 1960s Baltimore, BB Bakowsky (Richard Dreyfus) and Ernest Tilley (Danny De Vito) are rival aluminium siding salesmen brought together through an unfortunate car accident. Each blames the other and a full-on feud ensues. Revenge becomes a game and BB succeeds in making life even more complicated when in order to infuriate Tilley, he attempts to sleep with Tilley’s wife, Nora (Barbara Hershey) only to end up falling in love with her. Although the dialogue is fast and furious with many hilarious scenes there is sense of a darker sadder story underneath. Cast includes John Mahoney, Seymour Cassel, Jackie Gayle.

results.title: Tin from the Malayan jungles
results.brief_description: A map shows the areas of the richest tin deposits in Malaya. Scenes of prospectors locating the deposits are followed by illustrations of the two main mining methods. Open cast by means of the hydraulic method or by power shovel and dredging using an enormous dredge. The dredging is considered the most productive and effective. The earth is processed until from 75 to 77 percent pure tin is derived. This is shipped to Singapore for refining and smelting.

results.title: Tin can craft
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Shows how camping utensils can be made from tin cans. Demonstrates the making of kettles, cups, pans etc. Stresses that clean cans must be used, with smooth edges, and that care must be taken when cutting the tin.

results.title: Timpani
results.creator_credit: World Mirror-Realist Films, Anvil Films, Ken Cameron and Muir Mathieson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”
A demonstration of the kettle drums, showing the complications of the tuning of each drum to the required pitch. The modern pedal kettle drum has a mechanism for automatic adjustment of the skin. A tuning gauge helps the timpanist to determine his pitch.
